(50) 15230th June, 1950CABINET" MINISTERS OF CABINET RANK "Note by the Prime minister the term " Minister of Cabinet rank " was introduced during the war to describe those Ministers who, though not in the War Cabinet, were of a statusequivalent to that of the members of a normal peace-time Cabinet. Its use inpeace-time is anomalous and should be discontinued. Ministers (other than theLaw Officers and junior Ministers) fall into two categories only: Cabinet ministers and Ministers not in the Cabinet.C. R. A.10 Downing Street, S.W.I,30th June, 1950.
